messages.content: ComfyUI-DDColor is a node that allows the use of DDColor in ComfyUI.
Where can you find the DDColor models?
The DDColor models can be automatically downloaded to the `/checkpoints` folder using Hugging Face Hub or manually downloaded from https://huggingface.co/piddnad/DDColor-models/tree/main.
Where can you find information about the different DDColor models?
Information about the different DDColor models can be found at https://github.com/piddnad/DDColor/blob/master/MODEL_ZOO.md.
What are some working values for the model input size in ComfyUI-DDColor?
Some working values for the model input size in ComfyUI-DDColor are 256, 512, and 1024.
Does the model input size in ComfyUI-DDColor vary per model or image?
Yes, the model input size in ComfyUI-DDColor seems to vary per model or image.
How are the DDColor models selected in ComfyUI-DDColor?
The DDColor models are selected from a dropdown menu in ComfyUI-DDColor.
Is there a specific model input size that should be used for all models and images in ComfyUI-DDColor?
No, there is no specific model input size that should be used for all models and images in ComfyUI-DDColor, as it varies per model or image.
